title: Authorizes Congregation Ohr Yitzchok to file an application for exemption from real property taxes for a parcel in the town of Ramapo, county of Rockland
summary: Authorizes Congregation Ohr Yitzchok to file an application for exemption from real property taxes for a parcel in the town of Ramapo, county of Rockland.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2367

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 18, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. JAFFEE -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Real Property Taxation

       AN ACT to authorize Congregation Ohr Yitzchok to file an application for
         exemption  from  real  property  taxes  for  a  certain parcel of land
         located in the town of Ramapo, county of Rockland

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary,
    2  the  assessor  of the town of Ramapo is hereby authorized to accept from
    3  Congregation Ohr Yitzchok, a not-for-profit organization, an application
    4  for exemption from real property taxes pursuant to section 420-a of  the
    5  real  property tax law for the 2007, 2008 and 2009 assessment rolls, for
    6  the parcel owned by such organization located in the town of  Ramapo  at
    7  174  Maple  Avenue, Monsey, located at section 56.8, block 3, lot 55. If
    8  accepted, the application shall be reviewed as if it had  been  received
    9  on or before the taxable status date established for such rolls.
   10    If  satisfied  that  such not-for-profit corporation acquired title to
   11  such property for which it seeks exemption  subsequent  to  the  taxable
   12  status  date  established  for such roll and prior to the taxable status
   13  date for the next ensuing roll and would otherwise be entitled  to  such
   14  exemption  if  the  organization  had  filed  an  application  for  such
   15  exemption by the appropriate taxable status date, the  assessor  of  the
   16  town  of  Ramapo  upon  approval  by the town of Ramapo town board shall
   17  grant exemption from taxation with respect to the subject roll and  make
   18  appropriate  correction to the subject roll. If the exemption is granted
   19  and such not-for-profit corporation shall have paid any tax with  regard
   20  to  the  subject  roll,  the  town of Ramapo town board may, in its sole
   21  discretion, provide for the refund of those taxes paid and cancel taxes,
   22  fines, penalties, liens or interest remaining unpaid.
   23    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
